api package

Submodules

api.categories module

Contains category related API

api.categories.get_categories()
GET /categories

Returns all the categories

Query Parameters

  • sort – (optional) one of hit, created-at

  • offset – (optional) offset number. default is 0

  • limit – (optional) limit number. default is 30

Request Headers

  • Accept – the response content type depends on Accept header

  • Authorization – optional OAuth token to authenticate

Response Headers

  • Content-Type – this depends on Accept header of request

Status Codes

  • 200 OK – no error

  • 404 Not Found – there’s no user

api.categories.update_category(category_id)
PUT /category/(int: category_id)

Updates an existing category

Request Headers

  • Accept – application/json

  • Authorization – Bearer token

  • Content-Type – application/x-www-form-urlencoded

Parameters

  • category_id (int) – post’s unique id

Form Parameters

  • category_new_name – new updated name for category

Response Headers

  • Content-Type – application/json

Status Codes

  • 204 No Content – Category was updated

  • 400 Bad Request – bad request

  • 401 Unauthorized – You do not have authorization

api.users module

Contains user related API

api.users.add_user(user)
POST /users

Adds a new user

Request Headers

  • Accept – application/json

  • Authorization – Bearer token

JSON Parameters

  • user_name (string) – The name of new user

  • super_user (boolean) – whether it’s a superuser or not

Response Headers

  • Content-Type – application/json

Status Codes

  • 201 Created – user was created

  • 400 Bad Request – bad request

  • 401 Unauthorized – You do not have authorization

Example request:

POST /users HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Accept: application/json, text/javascript
Authorization: Bearer dX5g57pbafuav54b1a5f

{
  "user_name": "New User",
  "super_user" : true
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 201 CREATED
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: text/javascript

{
  'message': 'created'
}
api.users.get_users()
GET /users

Returns all the users who are registered on this application

Query Parameters

  • sort – (optional) one of hit, created-at

  • offset – (optional) offset number. default is 0

  • limit – (optional) limit number. default is 30

Request Headers

  • Accept – application/json

  • Authorization – Bearer token

Response Headers

  • Content-Type – application/json

Status Codes

  • 200 OK – success

  • 404 Not Found – there’s no user

Example request:

GET /users HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Accept: application/json, text/javascript
Authorization: Bearer dX5g57pbafuav54b1a5f

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: text/javascript

[
  {
    "user_id": 12345,
    "user_name": "John Doe"
  },
  {
    "user_id": 12346,
    "user_name": "Jane Doe"
  }
]
